components.content:
`digital-form-builder` is a metadata-driven framework that builds top of a
robust, enterprise technical stack and the new gov.uk frontend Design System.
It allows form-based gov.uk sites to be easily built with a graphical design tool.
A designer and developer can use the tool alongside subject matter experts and service owners to quickly map efficient user journeys, ready to be tested in production ready code.

Using the graphical design tool, users can build sites from a toolkit of common GDS patterns that includes Pages, Sections and Navigation elements along with Components like Text Fields, Radios Buttons, Checkboxes and Date Fields.

The framework is <a href="/split">flexible<a/>. It is capable of handling a number of different scenarios where form based page are required. E.g. collecting data in a transactional service or checking if a service is suitable for an end user.

• Data quality is assured though data processing and validation rules.
  • Designers and subject matter experts can collaborate during the design process, creating optimised user journeys and intuitive content with clear visuals that are easy to work with and understand.
  • Reduces the amount of bespoke development required in both low volume and short process services.
  • The framework works as a plugin to an established and proven tech stack. This not only gives a robustness but also means that bespoke code can be run, side by side within the same site.
  • The code produced is GDS compliant and production ready, eliminating the duplication of effort from prototypes to build.

It's as much about the data as it is about the pages.
  • Piecemeal schema - component - page - section - site
  • Coercion - dates / list values
  • Check your answers
  • API vs Forms

Take a look around the available tools:
  • Pages
  • Links
  • Sections
  • Components
Let's go ahead and add a Number Field to this page....

There are two piece of software that are available.

Designer This is the graphical tool we're using now.

Engine This is the runtime component that runs as a plugin to the hapi.js stack. It is responsible for interpreting the JSON file, registering the routes (pages), rendering the pages/preparing the Nunjucks config for each component on the page. It is also responsible for handling the POSTed data and validation.
